instructables.description: A BFO metal detector is a 'beat-frequency oscillator' type metal detector. This type of metal detector uses two wire coils, one which is large (detector coil) and one which is small (reference coil). The two wire coils are each connected to capacitors to create two circuits that oscillate. When everything is working correctly, the two coils, while being different sizes, are intended to have the same inductance. In use, the presence of metal near the detector coil changes it's inductance. This causes the two coils to have a different inductance, and the electronic circuit amplifies this difference and makes it audible through the speaker in the circuit. When you hear tones coming from the speaker you know there's some metal around.

thingiverse.title: Rotary Tool Handle
thingiverse.description:
This is a model and attachment scheme for a rotary grinding tool (like a Dremel) that uses a small dc motor and two limit / lever micro switches.cI harvested some motors and a handful of limit switches from an off-brand roomba to incorporate into this simple rotary grinding tool that i use to post process printed models.
The attachment scheme here is a 'hat' that can be deformed to snap-fit into a matching slot on the tool head piece. I've used this to make various sanding and grinding heads that i can swap in and out as i need to.
If you have a spare motor and a switch this model may be a way to turn those items into a usable bench tool. More likely, however, you might find this model instructive for basing your own design on.
Rotary Grinding Tool features
Removable / swappable toolheads
Tool heads can be any shape
Snap fit between tool head and motor mount

thingiverse.title: Pocket Operator Trigger POTR
thingiverse.description:
The incredibly fun to play Pocket Operator by Teenage Engineering is an awesome little sound machine. This model is a case, a trigger to press the write button, and a phone attachment arm.
I wanted to find a way to play the PO keys with my thumbs while I was holding down the write button in the bottom right corner.
The POTR has a lever that you can actuate with your fingers while you play the sound keys with your thumbs. In this way you can hold the Pocket Operator and also press the write button.
Now that you can walk around while you shred your electro-beats, you're going to want some way to share the insanity. The integrated phone holder attachment arm points your phone right at the Pocket Operator and keeps it there so you can rock on and on while also capturing the ear soup on video.
The POTR has several features:
Write button trigger / presser
Phone attachment with universal phone clamp
Extra batteries storage
Inserts for bolts to add weight

thingiverse.title: Pagoda Bird House
thingiverse.description:
This is a remix of tomatohead's great Birdhouse Pagoda Style https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:106401
I loved the Pagoda look but wanted bigger doors and a different kind of perch for the birds. This model simplifies some of the original design and turns the model into a four piece print.
This version of tomatohead's model is four pieces. The body has small holes in the floor to allow for drainage, The larger roof A has a recessed pentagon to receive the base. The second roof B just sits on top of the first and the mast is inserted through the hole in roof B and then glued into the mast hole in roof A. I've found the roof does not need to be glued into the roof A and will stay attached even hanging. This might be preferable if you want to be able to open it up to add seed, etc.

thingiverse.title: Low Polygon Mask Refactor
thingiverse.description:
This is a remix of cporto's Low Polygon Mask https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1097497
Sometimes you just need to give the gpu a rest and reduce your mesh detail. I wanted to make this model more consistently thick and add some slots for a strap.
In the process I also added a small curved piece to the temple on the inside to hold the mask slightly further away from the eyes. You can add some padding to this for comfort.
Printing this model upside down improved the results on my Ender-3. When i print this model right side up the last portion of the forehead had to much overhang and was delaminating.
Lucky Strike extra, I had a print detach from the build plate a third of the way through. I think the result makes a important statement about a lot of things that i find here on Thingiverse.

thingiverse.title: Harry Potter Hermione Ron
thingiverse.description:
This is a remix of Peter3dmaker's Harry Potter characters https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3112226
This Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger model is cut into 2 pieces and has slightly thicker wands to make it easier to print on a FDM machine.
By cleaning up the mesh, making the wands thicker and splitting it near the shoulders, I was able to print this successfully on my Ender 3 Pro with only minimal supports for Ron's hoodie and chin. I've also cleaned up the feet to make all three figures share a flat surface.

thingiverse.title: Ender 3 Y Carriage Plate Boom
thingiverse.description:
A boom attachment sized to mount on the Ender 3 Pro Y carriage.
This is designed to hang off the front of the y carriage plate and is mounted on the leveling bolts.
There are two models, one is a simpler lighter weight version and one is intended to be much stiffer. The bolt recesses make room for the leveling springs
It's possible that the most useful part of this model will be the carriage plate reference and workable mounting holes. There is a blender model included to potentially make it easier to make your own thing. use the model.
